channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: 24 years' jail and caning for paedophile who made siblings, aged 8 and 9, perform sex acts on each other
item.description:
July 17, 2020 2:44 PM

SINGAPORE - A 47-year-old paedophile, who took his lover's two young children to a Geylang hotel for regular "sleepovers" and made the eight-year-old girl and nine-year-old boy perform sexual acts on each other, was sentenced to 24 years' jail and 24 strokes of the cane on Friday (July 17).

item.title: SCDF ragging death: Two officers face less serious charges following trial
item.description:
July 17, 2020 2:10 PM

SINGAPORE - Two Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF) officers who had claimed trial overa ragging incident that claimed the life of a full-time national serviceman (NSF) two years ago are now facing less serious charges.

item.title: ST checks out SGH's new Covid-19 isolation room: I had only my boredom for company for 4 hours
item.description:
July 17, 2020 1:10 PM

SINGAPORE - With their metallic exterior, the box-like isolation rooms at Singapore General Hospital's newly built Ward@Bowyer resemble futuristic capsules sheltering people from the hustle and bustle of space travel.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore researchers discover antibodies that can neutralise virus, paving way for better treatment
item.description:
July 17, 2020 12:49 PM

SINGAPORE - The search for antibodies that can neutralise the coronavirus in a Covid-19 patient can be like looking for a needle in a haystack, but researchers in Singapore have prevailed.

item.title: SMU working with 8 firms to offer courses for mid-career PMEs under SGUnited Skills programme
item.description:
July 17, 2020 12:33 PM

SINGAPORE - The Singapore Management University (SMU) will work with eight companies in the private sector to co-deliver courses for mid-careerists.

item.title: Teenagers fined for using e-vaporiser on board MRT
item.description:
July 17, 2020 12:11 PM

SINGAPORE - Three teenagers who brazenly used an electronic vaporiser on board an MRT train, and posted the act on social media, have been hauled up by the authorities.

item.title: Browse and borrow books from National Library's first book dispenser at Lot One mall
item.description:
July 17, 2020 12:04 PM

SINGAPORE - Library users in Chua Chu Kang can now browse and borrow books even though the branch there is closed for renovations.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on July 17
SkillsFuture Month to kick off with forum on Covid-19's impact on work
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Education Minister Ong Ye Kung will launch this year's SkillsFuture Month at the SkillsFuture Forum this morning.

item.title: Approach in schools is to ring-fence if there is a Covid-19 case
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Education's (MOE) approach to Covid-19 cases in schools will be to ring-fence and quarantine students or staff on as small a scale as possible, as opposed to reacting with a full closure of schools.

item.title: Newborn red ruffed lemur twins are zoo's latest attraction
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Twin red ruffed lemur babies were born at the Singapore Zoo on Feb 22.

item.title: Coronavirus: New contact tracing device and check-in system on trial at worksite
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

The move is said to be necessary to avoid contributing to another wave of infections and business shutdowns.

item.title: Jail term increased for ex-town council GM
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

A former general manager of Ang Mo Kio Town Council (AMKTC), who is serving 27 months in jail for corruption, will have to spend a longer time in prison after his sentence was raised to three years and three months yesterday.

item.title: RWS casino among new places visited by infectious patients
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Resorts World Sentosa's (RWS) casino was among the new places visited by Covid-19 patients while they were still infectious, the Ministry of Health (MOH) said yesterday.

item.title: Former BP manager, businessman found guilty of corruption
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

A former manager at oil giant BP was found guilty yesterday of receiving US$3.95 million (S$5.5 million) in bribes from a businessman, who was also convicted.

item.title: Covid-19 report card: 7 indicators of how well a country has done in fighting outbreak
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

It outlines seven indicators that could signal if countries are ready to ease lockdowns.

item.title: CAAS to freeze fee increases for aviation firms till March 2021
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

The Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore (CAAS) announced yesterday that it will freeze scheduled fee increases for this financial year to mitigate the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: No cases of reinfection among recovered patients here, says NCID
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

There have not been any cases of reinfection among recovered Covid-19 patients in Singapore, the National Centre for Infectious Diseases (NCID) said yesterday.

item.title: Some new BTO flats may be delayed by up to 9 months: HDB
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Retail sales assistant Joyce Loh and her husband were supposed to get the keys to their new Build-To-Order (BTO) flat in Bukit Batok last month, but will now have to wait till the start of next year.

item.title: Morrison congratulates PM on election results
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong yesterday received a phone call from his Australian counterpart Scott Morrison, who congratulated him on the results of the general election last Friday.

item.title: Job losses likely to hit MBS eventually, say analysts
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

It is likely a matter of time before Marina Bay Sands (MBS) will have to let go of some of its staff due to the fallout from the Covid-19 pandemic, said analysts, following a retrenchment exercise by fellow integrated resort operator Resorts World Sentosa (RWS).

item.title: RWS layoffs bode ill for tourism sector
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

The layoffs at Resorts World Sentosa (RWS) are a sign of things to come for Singapore's tourism sector, industry observers warn.

item.title: Shorter TEL service hours before opening of 2nd stage
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Operating hours of train services on the Thomson-East Coast Line (TEL) will be shortened from July 20 to Aug 30 as the new line gears up for the next stage of its opening, said rail operator SMRT on Wednesday.

item.title: In-depth conversations on religion, race crucial in schools: Ong Ye Kung
item.description:
July 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Young people today have a different view of race and religion as compared with older generations, and conversations in school play a big role in helping students navigate differences, Education Minister Ong Ye Kung said yesterday.

item.title: Gojek introduces cancellation fee and option for multiple drop-off points
item.description:
July 17, 2020 12:01 AM

SINGAPORE - Passengers booking trips on ride-hailing app Gojek will have to pay a $4 cancellation fee under certain circumstances from next week.
